sen.e: Chinese gasan

sen.j: 中国における画讃とは、人物画にちなんで制作された文章を指す。
sen.e: In China, a "gasan" is a text produced in relation to a portrait.

sen.j: 唐時代まで、主として使用された用語。
sen.e: The term was mainly used up to the Tang dynasty.

sen.j: 宋時代以降の絵画に付属する文章は、主として「題」または「跋」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Text added to paintings in the Sung period and later was called "dai" or "batsu".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Text added to paintings in the Sung period and later was called 題 (dai) or 跋 (batsu).

sen.e: Text added to paintings in the Sung period and later was called 題 (dai) or 跋 (batsu).

sen.j: 画賛／画讃という用語は希になった。
sen.e: The term "gasan" began to be used more rarely.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 賛というのは、人物の事跡を述べ賞揚する文学の一形式である。
sen.e: "San" is a style of literature which describes and praises somebody's performance.
賛 (San) is a style of literature which describes and praises somebody's performance.
sen.cmt: ・該当する漢字を併記しないと読者がSanとは何かがよくわからないと思い、左記のように修正しました。

sen.j: 日本における画讃とは、絵画の主として上部の空白部に書き込んだ詩文を言う。
sen.e: In Japan, "gasan" refers to poetry written in a blank space, usually on the upper part of a painting.

sen.j: 別紙に書いて接続する場合もある。
sen.e: Sometimes it is written on a separate sheet of paper and attached to the painting.
Sometimes it is written on a separate sheet of paper and attached to the painting.
Sometimes it is written on a separate sheet of paper and attached to the painting.

sen.j: 漢詩が多いが、和歌、俳句を書くこともある。
sen.e: Many gasan are Chinese poems but Japanese tanka poetry or haiku (.a Japanese lyric verse form having three unrhymed lines of five, seven, and five syllables) are also sometimes used.

sen.e: Many gasan are Chinese poems but Japanese tanka poetry or haiku (.a Japanese lyric verse form having three unrhymed lines of five, seven, and five syllables) are also sometimes written.

sen.j: 類似のものに「色紙形」がある。
sen.e: A similar thing is shikishi-gata.
A similar thing is 'shikishigata' (colored, square-shaped paper inscribed with verses, then cut and pasted onto the upper portion of large screens and sliding door panels).
sen.cmt: ・「」が英訳にはありませんでした。・用語集の用語検索を参照し、左記のように（）内の補足情報を入れました。
sen.e: A similar thing is 'shikishigata' (colored, square-shaped paper inscribed with verses, then cut and pasted onto the upper portion of large screens and sliding door panels).

sen.j: 空海が真言七祖像の上部に書いた賛（京都府・東寺）が古い例である。
sen.e: An old example of san is written on the upper part of "Shingon shichiso-zo" (figures of seven patriarchs in the Shingon sect of esoteric Buddhism) by Kukai (To-ji temple, Kyoto prefecture).
An old example of san is written on the upper part of "Shingon Shichisozo" (figures of seven patriarchs in the Shingon sect of esoteric Buddhism) by Kukai (To-ji temple, Kyoto prefecture).
sen.cmt: ・用語集の用語検索を参照し、真言七祖像の表記を修正しました。

sen.j: 禅僧が修行を終えた弟子に自分の肖像画（頂相）に画讃をいれて、弟子に与える習慣が、鎌倉時代以降、禅宗とともに導入された。
sen.e: The practice of a Zen monk giving his portrait with gasan to his disciple after he had completed ascetic training was introduced together with the Zen sect after the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The practice of a Zen monk giving his portrait (or called Chinzo) with gasan to his disciple after he had completed ascetic training was introduced together with the Zen sect after the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: ・「頂相」にあたる部分がなかったので補足しました。
sen.e: The practice of a Zen monk giving his portrait (or called Chinzo) with gasan to his disciple after he had completed ascetic training was introduced together with the Zen sect after the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 以後讃を絵画にいれる習慣が一般化した。
sen.e: After that the practice of adding san to a painting became common.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After that the practice of adding san to a painting became common.

sen.j: 室町時代には、賛詩を必須とする詩画軸、上部に賛のある寒山拾得などの禅画が多数制作された。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, many "shigajiku"(paintings with a san of Chinese poetry in the form of a hanging scroll) for which a san poem is essential were produced in large numbers, as were paintings by Zen monks such as "Kanzan-Jittoku" motif paintings with a san on their upper part (Kanzan and Jittoku were unworldly persons who lived in the Tang period and who were often used as the subject matter for paintings by Zen monks).
sen.cmt: 詩画軸および寒山拾得の説明文を加えました。

sen.j: 江戸時代には狂歌や俳句の賛がある絵画や浮世絵も多い。
sen.e: Many paintings and ukiyo-e woodblock prints from the Edo period have a san of "kyoka" (a type of humorous poem) or haiku.
Many paintings and ukiyoe woodblock prints from the Edo period have a san of kyoka (comic [satirical] tanka) or haiku.

sen.j: 色紙形
sen.e: Shikishi-gata (shikishi shape)
Shikishigata
sen.cmt: ・用語集の用語検索を参照し、色紙形の表記を修正しました。
sen.e: Shikishigata

sen.j: 絵画の面の一部（上部が多い）を方形に線で区切って、多くは別の色や胡粉で塗りつぶす。
sen.e: A part (commonly an upper part) of a painting is marked with boundary lines to make the shape of a square, and in many cases this square is either painted in a different color to the rest of the painting or is whitewashed.

sen.j: その上に絵画にちなんだ、仏教経典の抜粋、詩文、題字を書き込む。
sen.e: An excerpt from Buddhist scriptures, or poetry, related to the painting, or the title of the painting, is then written.
An excerpt from Buddhist scriptures, poetry or inscription related to the painting is then written.

sen.j: 色紙を貼り付けたような形になる。
